title: Can't browse anything on Firefox
content:
Getting the following message on any and all websites... please help. I have no Firewall installed. First time this is happening. I deleted all extensions, still showing so. Google Chrome is working fine implying no internet issue.

"Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site.

We can’t connect to the server at support.mozilla.org.

If you entered the right address, you can: 

   Try again later    Check your network connection    Check that Firefox has permission to access the web (you might be connected but behind a firewall)"
creator: shreyanshsinghvi

title: Imitating Firefox
content:
As I was using Firefox today I got this. https://search.soddeskfine.live/vupmsilr/?utm_campaign=y0rsMyowMImIDv9DTSX69oig88PrjKrJ9agQ3DpV-9I1&t=back4&f=1&sid=t2~joutodrs5sc3nyxfxglgcaim&fp=cLR6e4eyZh8orFbu6fCYQg%3D%3D

which is clearly imitating Firefox and can be harm to our PCs. Please look into this. Thanks.
creator: antonasiri

title: Where in SETTINGS do you find "connecting to Public wifi"
content: I cannot connect to any Starbuck's or McDonald's ISP, Public Connection. My computer will say I will have "internet access", but when you go to get enter any URL it will time out saying "no internet access". and yes, it always works fine with my home wifi. I'm using Firefox with windows 7. Thank You
creator: 17am
